clinical_study.brief_title: Hydration Status and Kidney Disease in Patients With Pulmonary Hypertension
clinical_study.official_title: Hydration Status and Kidney Disease in Patients With Pulmonary Hypertension - A Cross-sectional Single-center Study

brief_summary.textblock: Cross-sectional evaluation of hydration status and kidney function in patients with pulmonary hypertension

detailed_description.textblock: This cross-sectional study is designed to evaluate the hydration and nutritional status and kidney function in patients with pulmonary hypertension at outpatient clinic via bioimpedance and urine analysis.

primary_outcome.measure: Determination of hydration status according to renal function in patients with pulmonary hypertension

secondary_outcome.measure: Determination of nutritional status according to renal function in patients with pulmonary hypertension
Correlation of hydration status with b-type natriuretic peptide

arm_group.description: Patients with pulmonary hypertension irrespective of WHO class and all chronic kidney disease stages

biospec_descr.textblock: Collection of only residual material (blood, urine) for Deutsche Zentrum für Lungenforschung Biobank

study_pop.textblock: All patients with diagnosed pulmonary hypertension at outpatient clinic

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Older than 18 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients refusing to participate
- Deterioration of the patients` clinical condition independent of origin
